data.title: Ranbir Kapoor's Animal to Shah Rukh Khan's Dunki — 10 most-awaited films releasing in December 2023
data.meta_description: Here's a list of all the new movies releasing in December 2023 - Animal, Dunki, Salaar Part 1- Ceasefire, Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom and more
data.text:
December 2023 has started on a high note with the release of Ranbir Kapoor's Animal and Vicky Kaushal's war drama Sam Bahadur on the first day of the month. Other big-budget films to release this month are Prabhas' much-awaited Salaar Part 1- Ceasefire, Netflix's musical drama The Archies, Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom featuring Jason Momoa, and more. These movies cover a diverse range of genres like action, comedy, thriller, romance, and adventure. Scroll down to browse through all the Hollywood, Bollywood, and South cinematic extravaganzas set to release in December 2023.

Ranbir Kapoor's Animal to Shah Rukh Khan's Dunki — 10 most-awaited films releasing in December 2023

1. Sam Bahadur

Release Date: December 1

Directed by Meghna Gulzar, Sam Bahadur is a biographical war drama that tells the tale of Sam Manekshaw, India's first field marshal who led the Indian Army during the 1971 Indo-Pakistan War. Vicky Kaushal plays the title role in the Bollywood movie which features Fatima Sana Shaikh, Sanya Malhotra, Neeraj Kabi, and Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub in supporting roles.

2. Animal

Release Date: December 1

Starring Ranbir Kapoor, Bobby Deol, Anil Kapoor, Rashmika Mandanna, and Tripti Dimri in lead roles, Animal is another exciting film that was released today, on December 1st. Written and directed by Sandeep Reddy Vanga, the film explores the complex relationship between a father-son duo. As the plot progresses the latter's obsession for his father's love and acceptance pushes him on a violent path.

3. Annapoorani - The Goddess Of Food

Release Date: December 1

Annapoorani - The Goddess Of Food is a light-hearted film that tells the story of a girl who embarks on a journey to fulfill her dream of becoming a chef. From enrolling in a culinary school to participating in a food competition, she goes beyond her conventional beliefs and prejudices to achieve her goal. The Tamil film is headlined by Nayanthara, who recently made her Bollywood debut with Jawan, co-starring Shah Rukh Khan.

4. Hi Nanna

Release Date: December 7

Hi Nanna is a feel-good family entertainer that centres around a doting father and his six-year-old daughter whose lives are upended when the former's love decides to marry someone else. The Telugu romantic movie starring Nani and Mrunal Thakur marks the directorial debut of Shouryuv. According to various online reports, Shruti Haasan and Angad Bedi are also reported to be a part of the project.

5. The Archies

Release Date: December 7 (Netflix)

Filmmaker Zoya Akhtar is all set to transport us back to the '60s with her next, The Archies. Arriving directly on Netflix, the teen musical flick is inspired by Archie Comics and delves into the lives of Archie Andrews and his group of friends as they navigate through friendship and romance while trying to save a park in Riverdale. The ensemble cast of the film features Agastya Nanda, Suhana Khan, Khushi Kapoor, Vedang Raina, Mihir Ahuja, Aditi Saigal, and Yuvraj Menda in pivotal roles.

6. Joram

Release Date: December 8

After receiving a good response at the Busan International Film Festival, the International Film Festival Rotterdam, and the Jio MAMI Mumbai Film Festival, Manoj Bajpayee starrer Joram is all set to release in theatres in December. Written and directed by Devashish Makhija, the film follows a desperate man who along with his infant daughter is on a run from the ghosts of his past who want them dead at any cost. The upcoming survival drama also features Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub, Rajshri Deshpande, Tannishtha Chatterjee, and Smita Tambe in prominent roles.

7. Wonka

Release Date: December 8

Director Paul King's upcoming musical fantasy drama Wonka tells the origin story of Willy Wonka, a young man selling chocolate in a small shop who went on to become an eccentric chocolatier known for his unique candies. Timothée Chalamet plays the title role in the upcoming Hollywood film. It also features Rowan Atkinson, Keegan-Michael Key, Calah Lane, Sally Hawkins, and Paterson Joseph in significant roles.

8. Dunki

Release Date: December 21

After delivering hits like Pathaan and Jawan, Shah Rukh Khan is all set to return to the big screen with another blockbuster this December. Titled Dunki, the plot of the upcoming comedy-drama is reported to explore the concept of Donkey Flight, an illegal route used by Indians to migrate to other countries like the UK, Canada, and the US. Directed by Rajkumar Hirani, the upcoming film also features Taapsee Pannu, Vicky Kaushal, and Boman Irani in pivotal roles.

9. Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom

Release Date: December 21

Set years after the events of the first installment, Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom continues to follow Arthur Curry/Aquaman who is forced to form an unlikely alliance with his brother Orm to protect Atlantis from Black Manta, who now wields the power of the Black Trident. The ensemble cast of the upcoming superhero flick includes Jason Momoa, Patrick Wilson, Amber Heard, Yahya Abdul-Mateen II, and Nicole Kidman.

10. Salaar: Part 1 – Ceasefire

Release Date: December 22

Prabhas joins forces with Prithviraj Sukumaran, Shruti Haasan, and Jagapathi Babu for Prashanth Neel's upcoming action thriller Salaar: Part 1 – Ceasefire. Made on a budget of over Rs 200 crore, the film is reported to revolve around a gangster who embarks on a mission to take down other criminals to fulfill a promise.
